dependencies.description: A pure-Python, bring-your-own-I/O implementation of HTTP/1.1
dependencies.name: py-h11

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
Priority is a pure-Python implementation of the priority logic for
HTTP/2, set out in RFC 7540 Section 5.3 (Stream Priority). This logic
allows for clients to express a preference for how the server allocates
its (limited) resources to the many outstanding HTTP requests that may
be running over a single HTTP/2 connection.
dependencies.name: py-priority

dependencies.description:
A Python library for parsing and creating TOML configuration files. For
more information on the TOML standard, see https://github.com/toml-
lang/toml.git
dependencies.name: py-toml

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description:
This repository contains a pure-Python implementation of a WebSocket
protocol stack. It's written from the ground up to be embeddable in
whatever program you choose to use, ensuring that you can communicate
via WebSockets, as defined in RFC6455, regardless of your programming
paradigm.
dependencies.name: py-wsproto

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description: A Python ASGI web microframework with the same API as Flask.
dependent_to.name: py-quart

description: A ASGI Server based on Hyper libraries and inspired by Gunicorn.
name: py-hypercorn

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
